field.name: summary
field.value: Inheritable attributes on virtual properties not available on proxy

field.name: description
field.value:
Not only on 2.1 RTM but also on trunk
Steps to reproduce: 1) Add a inheritable attribute to a virtual property. 2) Create a proxy of the class.
Expected outcome: the attribute is available on the proxy
Actual outcome: the attribute is not available on the proxy.

comment.author: bart
comment.text:

Added a patch with a proposed solution. All tests are passing with that patch but I am absolutely not sure that this is THE solution. If I read the code it seems that it was assumed that the inheritable attributes would automatically be taken over on the proxy which definitely does not seem to be case. btw, you should take the last patch I uploaded. I could not find a delete option for the first one.

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text:
IIRC this is by design. If attribute is inheritable, it is accessible in the inheriting classes, so inheritable attributes should be available if you query for them from proxy type.
Can you give an example where it's causing an issues?
